Description:
Responsible for managing all fleet management activities and providing clients with the right vehicles at the right price and time in line with the company’s set standards, in order to maximize client satisfaction and company revenues.
Develop the Fleet Management Department’s strategic objectives and KPIs and ensure all employees are working towards achievement of these objectives.
Review the operating results of the Fleet management Department and follow-up to ensure appropriate measures are taken to correct insufficient results.
Develop the Fleet management Department’s annual budget and ensure all employees are working within the assigned budget by setting the required targets and responsibilities.
Implement the Fleet management Department’s policies and the set procedures in order to achieve the Fleet management Department’s objectives.
Communicate and discuss the Fleet management Department’s guidelines and procedures with employees to ensure responsibilities, authorities and accountabilities are defined and understood.
Manage, analyze and review the investigations/ market surveys conducted by subordinates in order to gather information regarding the selling/ leasing prices offered by dealers.
 Keep up to date with current market vehicles’ prices by surveying local selling/ leasing rates.
Oversee inbound/ outbound logistics operations, such as transportation, safety performance, or logistics quality management.
 Analyze and utilize all fleet information and user surveys to forecast new requirements.
 Ensure fleet availability to meet all clients’ requests by scheduling, forecasting and surveying current clients’ trends.
 Ensure vehicle registration, insurance and documentation regarding induction of new vehicles in existing fleet.
Oversee data management system to organize fleets as per various schedules and requests.
Monitor the maintenance of an up to date and secured database including documents related to sales, registration, inspections and maintenance of fleet vehicles.
Develop and implement standard operational standards to maintain vehicles by advocating best practices in the industry.
Plan, process and execute vehicle purchase and vehicle replacement through efficient settlement.
Oversee activities related to utilization, repair, preventative maintenance and replacement of the vehicle fleet.
Authorize requisitions for parts, supplies and equipment in; as well as, oversee automotive damage repairs and all activities related to the mechanical repairs and maintenance of fleet vehicles to obtain maximum utilization of fleet and prevent operational delays.
Guide and assist subordinates whenever required to ensure smooth workflow of operations.
Maintain a solid relationship with current clients and attract new clients in order to increase client’s database and profitability.
Review and present reports on Fleet Management activities, including identification of potential problems and recommendations for corrective action, forecasts trends and make recommendations.
Prepare and submit reports (daily, weekly, monthly, etc.) to Direct Management, as required, that cover all Fleet Management Department’s activities and other related fields.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor’s Degree in mechanical engineering, business administration or automotive technology related field.
Minimum of 8 – 10 years of experience in the transportation industry, logistics field.
 Ability to work effectively under pressure and to meet deadlines, while handling multiple tasks.
Excellent strategic planning abilities
Ability to develop specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish the work.
Thorough knowledge of the occupation hazards and corresponding safety precautions necessary for the safe performance of assigned duties.
 Excellent leadership and customer experience skills.
Proficiency in English and Arabic is an added value.
Good level of verbal and written communication skills.
